definitions.text: an assertion of a right (as to money or property)
an assertion that something is true or factual
examples: his claim that he was innocent

definitions.text: demand for something as rightful or due
examples: they struck in support of their claim for a shorter work day
a strong legal claim to the property
he had no documents confirming his title to his father's estate

definitions.text: a demand especially in the phrase
assert or affirm strongly; state to be true or existing
examples: He claimed that he killed the burglar

definitions.text: demand as being one's due or property; assert one's right or title to
examples: He claimed his suitcases at the airline counter
Mr. Smith claims special tax exemptions because he is a foreign resident

definitions.text: ask for legally or make a legal claim to, as of debts, for example
examples: They claimed on the maximum allowable amount

definitions.text: lay claim to; as of an idea
examples: She took credit for the whole idea

definitions.text: take as an undesirable consequence of some event or state of affairs
examples: The hard work took its toll on her
